ChefsHatGym.env package¶

Submodules¶

ChefsHatGym.env.ChefsHatEnv module¶

class ChefsHatGym.env.ChefsHatEnv.ChefsHatEnv¶

Bases: sphinx.ext.autodoc.importer._MockObject

ChefsHatEnv is the Chefs Hat game enviromnet class that allows to start and execute each step of the game. To instatiate the class, use gym.make(‘chefshat-v0’).

Parameters:playerPosition (int, mandatory) – The finishing position of the player
Returns:Integer the score of the given player.
Return type:int

getHighLevelActions()¶

Generate all the possible actions in a human-friendly way

Returns:highLevelActions - List :rtype: list
getObservation()¶

Get a new observation. The observation is composed of the current board, the playersHand and the possible actions.

Returns:The observation is an int data-type ndarray. The observation array has information about the board game, the current player’s hand, and current player possible actions. This array must have the shape of (228, ) as follows: The first 11 elements represent the board game card placeholder (the pizza area). The game cards are represented by an integer, where 0 (zero) means no card. The following 17 elements (from index 11 to 27) represent the current player hand cards in the sequence. By the end, the last 200 elements (from index 28 to 227) represent all possible actions in the game. The allowed actions for the current player are filled with one, while invalid actions are filled with 0.
Return type:ndarray

This method increments episodeNumber, start a new game and return the first observation

Returns:The first observation array after the game has started. The observation is an int data-type ndarray.
Return type:ndarray
restartBoard()¶

restart the board

startExperiment(rewardFunctions=[], gameType='POINTS', stopCriteria=3, maxInvalidActions=10, playerNames=[], logDirectory='', verbose=0, saveLog=False, saveDataset=False)¶

This method stores parameters for a new exeperiment. An experiment is a set of games (see startNewGame method).

Parameters:
  • rewardFunctions (list, mandatory) – A list of reward functions for each player, defaults to []
  • gameType (str, optional) – The game type (“POINTS” or “MATCHES”), defaults to GAMETYPE[“POINTS”]
  • stopCriteria (int, optional) – Number of “MATCHES” or “POINTS” to stop the experiment, defaults to 3
  • maxInvalidActions (int, optional) – How many invalid or continuous pass actions an Agent can do before a random action is assigned to it, defaults to 10
  • playerNames (list, mandatory) – A list of names for each player, defaults to []
  • logDirectory (str, optional) – The path for log directory, defaults to “”
  • verbose (int, optional) – Verbose level (0 to 1), defaults to 0
  • saveLog (bool, optional) – Whether the log file will be generated (True) or not (False), defaults to False
  • saveDataset (bool, optional) – Whether the game dataset will be saved (True) or not (False), defaults to False
startNewGame()¶

Starts a new game using the parameters defined by the method startExperiment. You have to define the game type (per points or per game), and the stoping criteria (maximum points, maximum games). For logging purpose, set the saveLog, verbose and logDirectory in startExperiment method.

startNewmatch()¶

Start a new match

step(action)¶

Execute an action in the game.

Parameters:action (ndarray) – The action array with 200 elements, where the choosen action is the index of the highest value
Returns:a tuple cointaining: observation - ndarray return of reward function - float True if the match is over, False if not - bool info - dict: { ‘actionIsRandom’:(bool), ‘validAction’: (bool), ‘matches’: (bool), ‘rounds’: (int), ‘score’: (int), ‘performanceScore’: (int), ‘thisPlayer’: (int), ‘thisPlayerFinished’: (bool), ‘isPizzaReady’: (bool), ‘boardBefore’: (ndarray), ‘boardAfter’: (ndarray), ‘possibleActions’: (list), ‘action’: (ndarray), ‘thisPlayerPosition’: (int), ‘thisPlayerPosition’: (ndarray), ‘players’: (list), }
Return type:tuple
